editionStmt.edition: Digital edition according to TEI P5

availability.licence: This document is published under the Creative Commons licence Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0).

msDesc.head: Astronomical collection North-east France, Saint Amand(?) s. X Digital facsimile at gallica.bnf.fr.

supportDesc.foliation: Double foliation (1-187) with a pencil the forner one crossed out on the upper right corner of every recto.
supportDesc.collation: According to Hubert Le Bourdellès the first quire is a senion missing its 1-9-10-11-12 folios. Manuscript inspected online. Quire structure is uncertain:I12(-5)(ff.1-7); II6 (ff.8-13); III-VI8 (ff.14-21, 22-29, 30-37, 38-45); VII probably two bifolia (ff. 46-49); VIII-IX8 (ff.50-57, 58-65); X probably a bifolium (ff. 66-67) followed by XI10 (ff.68-76); XII-XXIV8 (ff.77-84, 85-92, 93-100, 101-108, 109-116, 117-124, 125-132, 133-140, 141-148, 149-156, 157-164, 165-172, 173-180); XXV8(-1) (ff.181-187).

condition.p: f. 2 hole in the outer margine; f. 30, 45, lower edge damaged; f. 49 hole in the lower half; f. 65 smudged; f. 67 damaged - one section cut and resewed with cord.

layoutDesc.layout: ff. 1-6r, 14-35 and 58-187 written in 27 long lines.
Rubrics and initials in red capitalis rustica or monumental capitalis (partly faded and illegible). Red also used in the calendar and the tables.

handDesc.handNote: Two hand in the Excerptum (change f.1r, line 14), the second wrote also the Ad boreae. The Anonymus Sangallensis written by at least three different hands.
Corrections including the additions of middle dot in darker ink.

binding.p: Medieval (?) leather binding, no paste down, tunnels and thongs visible.

history.summary: The core of the manuscript is Bede'sDe tempore ratione preceded by a his De natura rerum and a computistical collection ascribed to him. To this volume were then added two codicological units written by similar contemporary hands: Part I (ff.1-7) with astronomica and Part II (ff.8-13) with Bede's De temporibus.
history.origin: Based on annus currens mentioned in the computistical section Borst considered that the manuscript was copied around 975 from an exemplar from around 880. The inclusion of Annales Elnonenses and the list of abbots of Saint-Amand indicates the Abbey of Saint-Amand as the place of production. The Abbey was severely devasted by the Normans and received help for the restoration of the Abbey from Fulbert, bishop of Cambrai and from Hildebrand and Gérard of Brogne, Abbots of Saint-Bertin. It is then possible that the exemplar of our manuscirpt arrived from these houses (sse Blouard, René. “Saint Gérard de Brogne.” Le Guetteur Wallon, no. 3 (1959): 61-140.
history.provenance: The many additions datable up to s. XIII testify that the manuscript was used continously during several centuries. The list of abbots of Saint-Amand, which was extended till the s. XVIII suggests that the manuscript remained in the Abbey till s. XVIII. The twelfth-century catalogue of Saint-Amand (Paris, BnF, MS lat. 1850) includes three books of Bede Bede tres de naturis rerum et temporibus, which Delisle identified as Valenciennes, BM, Ms 166 and 330bis - the former shelfmark of our manuscript (Delisle,Le cabinet des manuscrits de la Bibliothèque impériale nationale, 3 vols. (Paris, 1868-81), II, p. 452).
Notes on the front paste-down:Liber s. Amandipa ; with black ink B 105; with pencil III 6.

listBibl.head: Selected Bibliography:
listBibl.bibl: Bischoff, Bernhard. Die Abtei Lorsch im Spiegel ihrer Handschriften. 2nd ed. Lorsch: Laurissa, 1989, p. 82, No. 30.
Boschen, Lothar. Die Annales Prumienses: ihre nähere und ihre weitere Verwandtschaft. Düsseldorf: Schwann, 1972.
Chardonnens, László Sándor. Anglo-Saxon Prognostics, 900-1100: Study and Texts. Brill, 2007.
Grierson, Philip. Les annales de Saint-Pierre de Gand et de Saint-Amand: annales Blandinienses, annales Elmarenses, annales Formoselenses, annales Elnonenses. Brussels: Kiessling, 1937.
Le Bourdellès, Hubert. “De Astronomia more Christiano.” Studi medievali, ser. 3 32 (1991): 385–444.
Smith, Julia M.H. “A Hagiographer at Work: Hucbald and the Library of Saint-Amand.” Revue Bénédictine 106 (1996): 151–71.

msItem.title: Excerptum de astrologia(acephalus)
msItem.incipit: ad australeplagam centaurum bestiam manu quasi ad aram ferentem

msItem.author: Ps.Priscian
msItem.title: Ad boreae partes
msItem.rubric: Incipit epitome phenomenon id est apparitio sive apparentia prisciani gramatici versus de sideribus
msItem.incipit: Ad boreae partes arcturi uerserunt et anguis
msItem.explicit: Hinc sequitur pistrix simul heridanique fluenta.
msItem.note: Correction in darker ink. Verses separated by ;

msItem.title: Anonymous Sangallensis
msItem.incipit: Herodius dicit elicem licaonis fuisse filiam quae a ioue uiolata
msItem.explicit: absides eius ultima in capricono est.

msItem.title: De astronomia more christiano
msItem.rubric: Item de astronomiamore christiano
msItem.incipit: Hae fisicae partes quae astronomia et astrologia dicuntur dum deest mathematica
msItem.explicit: de ceteris astronomicis conscribere signis.

msItem.note: Three computistical tables for lunar letters A-T (ff.6v-7r) and AEIOV (f.7v) for finding the age of the moon.

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: De temporibus
msItem.rubric: Liber bede temporibus
msItem.incipit: Tempora momentis horis diebus mensibus annis saeculis aetatibus diuiduntur
msItem.explicit: Reliquum sextae aetatis deo soli patet.
msItem.note: Following are a group of tracts, which are often associated with De temporibus and as Jones argues might be genuine works of Bede:

msItem.author: (Ps.) Bede
msItem.title: Opusculum Itaque stella veneris et mercurii
msItem.incipit: Itaque stella ueneris et mercurii hoc a superioribus tribus planetarum stellis differunt
msItem.explicit: et idcirco longiores aetheris metas peragat.

msItem.author: (Ps.) Bede
msItem.title: De apsidibus planetarum
msItem.rubric: De hapsidibus planetarum
msItem.incipit: Circulus zodiacus qui XII signis constat omni ex parte aeque vicinus est terrae
msItem.explicit: Et VII ut tamen decies reuolutus non LXXX sed potius LXX dierum numerum reddat.

msItem.title: Argumentum ad inveniendam XIIII lunam
msItem.rubric: Argumentum ad inveniendam XIIII lunam
msItem.incipit: Sume regulares XXXVI quas mensi martio apponere debebis
msItem.explicit: debes reliquum per septenos multiplicari.

msItem.incipit: secundum eusebium ad abracham usque ad christum anni ĪĪXV, ad salomone autem et prima edificatione templi a moyse autem et egressione ex aegypto anni ĪDXXVIIII. Si autem uis cognoscere per annos singulos quot sind epactae sume annos domini quot fuerint ut putam prseneti quarta indictione DCCCXI
msItem.explicit: fiunt CXLIII tolle CXX et remanent XXIII. istae sunf epactae lunares.

msItem.finalRubric: Finit libellus Bedae de temporibus. Primo editus.

msItem.rubric: Incipiunt capitula libri Bedae de natura rerumex opusculis sancti augustini
msItem.incipit: I. De quadrifario dei opere
msItem.explicit: Diuisio terrae

msItem.rubric: Versus Bedae presbiteri
msItem.incipit: Naturas rerum uarias labentis et aeui
msItem.explicit: Atque inde africa a meridie usque ad occidentem extenditur.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicat liber bedae de naturis rerum.

msItem.note: Computistical compendium with excerpts from Libri computi and Annalis libellus cap. 1-65, 69 in different order (keeping its annus praesens 80r: Anni ab incarnatione domini anno praesente suntDCCXCIII , but also adding the modernised years 877 and 972).

msItem.rubric: Incipiunt capitula libri eiusdem de numero
msItem.incipit: I. Rota quae continet diuersa sollemnia sanctorum in KL Nonibus uel Idibus per singulos menses
msItem.explicit: LXXXVI. Ratio de astronomia.

msItem.rubric: Incipit liber bedae presbiteri de numero.
msItem.note: After the rubric 15 lines left blank. Two prayers added later (s. X) Deus qui per sanguinem domini nostri ihesu christi in ligno crucis pacem hominibus et collegium caelestium angelorum dedisti da nobis et tuae pacis ubertate repleri et angelorum societate laetari pereundem and Saciati diuone misterio maiestatem tuam dominem suppliciter deprocamur et a cunctis periculis miseratus absoluas.
Table for the 28-year solar cycle for finding the day of the week.
msItem.rubric: Cyclus solaris uiginti octo annorum per XII kalendas.

msItem.note: Table for the 19-year lunar cycle; short text at the bottom .
msItem.rubric: Cyclus lunaris decem et nouem annorum per XII kalendas.
msItem.incipit: Primo decennouenalis anno in quo nullae sunt epaciae sic inuenies luna per kalendas quasque
msItem.explicit: in kl mai XXVIIIa cum XXVIIII per argumentum computatur.

msItem.note: Rota named from Borst Aachener Radkalender showing the natalicia sanctorum in Kalendis, Nonis et Idibus per unumquemque mensem.

msItem.rubric: Cursus lunae per XII signa XVIIII annorum
Incipit ordo solaris anni cum litteris a sancto ieronimo superpositis ad exploranda VIImanae diem et ad lunae aetatem inuestigandam in unoquoque die per XVIIII annos.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicunt IIIIa tempora anni menses XII ebdomade LII et una dies, dies CCCLXV et VI horae, horae V¯ĪĪĪDCCLX, momenta C¯C¯C¯L¯DCLX.
msItem.note: Several contemporary hands adding calendrical information discussed in Borst, Reichskalender, vol. 1, pp. 139-142.

msItem.rubric: Uersus de diebus egyptiacis
msItem.incipit: Bisdeni binique dies scribuntur in anno· In quibus una solet mortalibus hora timeri
msItem.explicit: Ne in media ima ruas sed clara per ethera uiuas.
msItem.note: The otherwise first two verses (Si tenebrae egyptus greco tenebrosos iure uocamus here come after verse 6 Nec simul hos iunctos homine peste trucident.
msItem.bibl: Edited in Chardonnens, László Sándor. Anglo-Saxon Prognostics, 900-1100: Study and Texts. Brill, 2007, p. 379.

msItem.title: Annales Elnonenses
msItem.bibl: Les annales de Saint-Pierre de Gand. Edited by Philip Grierson. Brussels, 1937, p. 132-175.

msItem.note:
On the bottom under the tables argumenta: f. 35vUnde supra. Si nosse uis annum incarnationis dominicae scito quot fuerint ordines indictianum
f. 45v Argumentum ad annum mundi inueniendum. Sci scire cupis annos ab inicio mundi multiplicaet hoc ordine deinceps seruito annos mundi sine errore reperies.

msItem.rubric: Anno primo cicli decennouenalis. Cursus uel aetas lunae hoc argumento cognoscitur.
msItem.note: On f. 65v after the end of the table a smudged note Os martis cepit lex quinque librorum. The rest of the page (ca. 14 lines) left blank.

List of the abbots in Saint Amand fromSanctus Amandus episcopus (633-678) to Leo potier de gesvres cardinal et archiepiscpus (1720-1722). The list was started probably in the s. XIII1 on originally blank page and continued till s. XVIII
msItem.rubric: Nomina abbatum elnonensis
De concurrentibus unde acceperunt exordium
msItem.incipit: Interrogandum est de concurrentibus septimanae diei unde acceperunt exordium
msItem.explicit: sed semper ad unum reuertaris et sic per XXVIII lineas discurras.

msItem.rubric: Unde procedunt regulares qui secundum sole nascuntur
msItem.incipit: Si uis scire unde procedunt regulares qui secundum solem numerantur Id sunt
msItem.explicit: remanent III Mai III et sic de ceteris.

msItem.rubric: Unde regulares lunae acceperunt exordium
msItem.incipit: Si uis scire unde procedunt regulares ad luna· Id sunt sept. V tene dies
msItem.explicit: Alia XXVIIII recidas.

msItem.incipit: In nomine patris et filii et spiritu sancti aius aius aius sanctus sanctus sanctus dominus deus sabaoth qui erat et qui est
msItem.explicit: et pax tibi fiat in diebus. Per signum sancte crucis tuis liberet te deus alleluia alleluia alleluia a sanctus sanctus sanctus iskarus

msItem.rubric: De singulis mensibus quae kalendas Nones uel ides De nonis idibus et kalendis singulorum mensium
msItem.incipit: Ianuarius augustus et december IIII nones habent
msItem.explicit: Omnes ergo menses VIII ides habent.

msItem.rubric: De ciclo solis. De singulis mensis kalendis nonis uel idibus
msItem.note: Table with Termini for the major moveable feasts.
Aid lists for to accompany argumentum ad invenienda feria; first list starting in January, the lower one in March.

msItem.incipit: (f.70r) XV. De ratione aequinoctii. A XII kalendis aprelis quod aequinoctium uernale usque in XIII kalendis iulii sunt dies XC et I(= Lib. ann. LIII)
msItem.explicit: Si uis scire quantos debeas adicere ad lunae cursum ita in singulis annis ut quanti super XXX fnt tantos habeat ad lunae cursum(= Lib. ann. XXVIII).

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Letter to Wicthede
msItem.rubric: Epistola Bedae ad uicthadum presbiterum de
msItem.incipit: Reuerentissimo ac sanctissimo fratri uicthado presbitero beda optabilem in domino salutem
msItem.explicit: aut ante aequinoctium fuisse confirmet.

msItem.note: List of Greek numerals, their value and name in Greek with latin characters and their equivalent in Roman numerals.
msItem.rubric: De compotu litterarum grecorum
msItem.incipit:
A mia i alpha
B dia ii beta
msItem.explicit: Θ̅ enaschile VIIII̅

msItem.note: Another list of Greek numerals and their Roman equivalent.

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: De temporum ratione
msItem.rubric: Praefatio de temporum libro incipit
msItem.incipit: De natura rerum et ratione temporum duos quondam stricto sermone libellos
msItem.explicit: cuncti caelestium praemiorum mereamur accipere palmam.

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Chronica maiora
msItem.rubric: Incipitchronica ab anno incarnationis domini ab initio uero mundi anno IIII DCC LXX
msItem.incipit: Iustinianus minor filius constantini regnauit annos X. Hic constituit pacem cum sarracenis decennio terra marique
msItem.explicit: Imperator hludouicus cum consilio francorum constituit.
